intro: Nassauvia glomerata, commonly known as clustered nassauvia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, adding ornamental value to its native habitat. Nassauvia glomerata is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and drought tolerance.
